title: 112_s874
content: Modification of month of death benefit for surviving spouses of veterans who die while entitled to compensation or pension. The amendment to section 5310 of title 38, United States Code, provides a surviving spouse of a veteran with a benefit for the month of the veteran's death if the veteran was receiving compensation or pension under chapter 11 or 15, or had a pending claim for benefits under these chapters at the time of death. The benefit amount is what the veteran would have received if they had not passed away. If a veteran dies while receiving benefits, the surviving spouse will receive accrued benefits. If a claim for benefits is pending at the time of the veteran's death, the spouse will receive the difference between the amount the veteran would have received and the amount already paid. The surviving spouse of a deceased veteran will receive accrued benefits, and any pending claims will be paid out accordingly. Payments made to the surviving spouse are exempt from delays in payment, and certain checks and payments cannot be requested to be returned. The surviving spouse of a deceased veteran will receive accrued benefits without delay. If a benefit payment is issued to the veteran for the month of their death and accessed by the surviving spouse, it will be considered payable to the spouse under certain conditions. The amendments made by this section will be effective upon the enactment of the Act and apply to deaths occurring on or after that date. Eligibility for Presidential Memorial Certificates for individuals who die while serving in the military. Section 112 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to allow the Secretary to conduct a program for honoring deceased veterans by sending certificates signed by the President to eligible recipients. The definition of a covered individual includes deceased veterans discharged under honorable conditions. The amended Section 112 of title 38, United States Code allows the Secretary to honor deceased veterans by sending certificates signed by the President to eligible recipients, including deceased veterans discharged under honorable conditions. MODIFICATION TO AUTHORIZE SATISFACTION OF OCCUPANCY REQUIREMENT ON PROPERTY FINANCED WITH HOUSING LOAN BENEFITS FOR VETERANS BY OCCUPANCY OF DEPENDENT CHILDREN: Section 3704(c) of title 38, United States Code is amended to allow veterans in active duty to satisfy occupancy requirements if their spouse or dependent child occupies the property as a home and meets certification requirements. SEC. 4. COVENANTS AND LIENS CREATED BY PUBLIC ENTITIES IN RESPONSE TO DISASTER-RELIEF ASSISTANCE. Paragraph (3) of section 3703(d) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to require that real estate housing loans be secured by a first lien on the property. The Secretary has the authority to allow for subordination to a superior lien created by a public or private entity for disaster assistance or homeowner obligations. The Secretary has the authority to allow for subordination to a superior lien created by a public or private entity for disaster assistance or homeowner obligations, as long as it benefits the development or community where the veteran's realty is located without prejudicing the interests of the veteran borrower and the Government.
